greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Order of first occurrence of a sequence of exactly n consecutive primes of the form 6*k-1.
comment: This sequence gives the index of A055626(n) after sorting by increasing magnitude.
link: Hugo Pfoertner, Record producing runs of primes of the forms 6k+-1
Hugo Pfoertner, FORTRAN function ISPRIM to check primality.
example: a(2)=2, a(3)=3, a(4)=4 because the first occurrence of exactly 3 consecutive primes of the form 6*k-1 (47,53,59) follows the first occurrence of exactly 2 (23,29) and precedes the first occurrence of exactly 4 (251,257,263,269) primes of this form.
xref: Cf. A055626, A085515 (sorted occurrence of first runs of "6k+1" primes).
results.author: _Hugo Pfoertner_, Jul 31 2003
ext: More terms from Herman Jamke (hermanjamke(AT)fastmail.fm), Oct 27 2006
